title: Deltaiso for Fedora 12 -> Fedora 13 Alpha TC1 i386 DVD
description:
Fraction of full ISO size: 37.3%
applydeltaiso's approximate running time (2-3 GHz CPU, 1-2 GiB RAM): 40 minutes

This deltaiso file allows one to generate the Fedora 13 Alpha TC1 i386 DVD image if one already has the Fedora-12-i386-DVD.iso image (either as an ISO file, or on DVD).  Using it requires a box running Fedora 11 or later, the deltarpm package (version 3.5 or later), and if running Fedora 12 or later, the deltaiso package (these are in the Fedora repos).  Use the applydeltaiso command as follows:

applydeltaiso oldiso deltaiso newiso 

where oldiso is the Fedora-12-i386-DVD.iso input image, deltaiso is the Fedora-12_13-Alpha.TC1-i386-DVD.diso file from this torrent, and newiso is the generated Fedora 13 Alpha TC1 i386 DVD output image.  If oldiso is on DVD, then one can just mount it and replace oldiso with /dev/dvd:

applydeltaiso /dev/dvd deltaiso newiso

Before downloading the deltaiso, make sure to have the correct, verified, input image.  The sha256sum for Fedora-12-i386-DVD.iso is

f0ad929cd259957e160ea442eb80986b5f01daaffdbcc7e5a1840a666c4447c7

If it's on DVD, one can simply do a mediacheck (or use the checkisomd5 command - "checkisomd5 --verbose /dev/dvd" is the equivalent of mediacheck without having to reboot).  After running applydeltaiso, verify the output image.  The sha256sum for the Fedora 13 Alpha TC1 i386 DVD ISO is

1bc43365fcf45711d7d8e137e0015a5b541446eca39ccc5c9e42044aaf2032a9
